intro: Potentilla stipularis, commonly known as the stipular cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, woody stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months, which are attractive to pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five leaflets, and are covered in fine hairs. Potentilla stipularis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
